TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Rows implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: A collection of objects that represent the table rows in the specified selection, range, or table.

remarks.para: Use the Rows property to return the Rows collection.
Use the method to add a row to a table.
Use Rows(), where is the index number, to return a single Row object. The index number represents the position of the row in the selection, range, or table.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Row Add([in]object& BeforeRow) runtime managed
Public Function Add (Optional ByRef BeforeRow As Object) As Row

Docs.param: Optional Object. A Row object that represents the row that will appear immediately below the new row.
Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents a row added to a table.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdRowAlignment Alignment { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdRowAlignment get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdRowAlignment value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a constant that represents the alignment for the specified rows.

remarks.para: WdRowAlignment can be one of the following constants:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int AllowBreakAcrossPages { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Determine if the text in a table row or rows is allowed to split across a page break.

remarks.para: This property returns True if the text in a table row or rows is allowed to split across a page break, and False if not.
The return value can be True, False or wdUndefined (only some of the specified text is allowed to split).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int AllowOverlap { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a value that specifies whether the specified rows can overlap other rows.

remarks.para: This property returns wdUndefined if the specified rows include both overlapping rows and non-overlapping rows.
The value of the property can be set to either True or False.
Setting AllowOverlap to True also sets to True. Setting to False also sets AllowOverlap to False.
Because HTML doesn't support overlapping tables or shapes, AllowOverlap is ignored in Web layout view.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Borders ^ Borders { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Borders ^ get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Borders ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a collection that represents all the borders for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range ConvertToText (ref object Separator, ref object NestedTables);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range ConvertToText([in]object& Separator, [in]object& NestedTables) runtime managed
Public Function ConvertToText (Optional ByRef Separator As Object, Optional ByRef NestedTables As Object) As Range

Docs.param: Optional Object. The character that delimits the converted columns (paragraph marks delimit the converted rows). Can be any following constants:wdSeparateByCommaswdSeparateByDefaultListSeparatorwdSeparateByParagraphswdSeparateByTabs (Default)
Optional Object. True if nested tables are converted to text. This argument is ignored if is not wdSeparateByParagraphs. The default value is True.
Docs.summary: Converts a table to text and returns a object that represents the delimited text.

remarks.para: When you apply the ConvertToText method to a object, the object is deleted. To maintain a reference to the converted contents of the table, you must assign the object returned by the ConvertToText method to a new object variable.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range ConvertToTextOld([in]object& Separator) runtime managed
Public Function ConvertToTextOld (Optional ByRef Separator As Object) As Range

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the number of items in the specified collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the specified object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the distance (in points) between the document text and the bottom edge of the specified table.

remarks.para: This property doesn't have any effect if is False.

Docs.summary: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int HeadingFormat { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Determine if the specified row or rows are formatted as a table heading.

remarks.para: This property returns true if the specified row or rows are formatted as a table heading, and false if not.
Rows formatted as table headings are repeated when a table spans more than one page.
This values this property can be set to are True, False and wdUndefined.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Height { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the height of the specified row or rows in a table.

remarks.para: If the property of the specified rows is wdRowHeightAuto, Height returns wdUndefined; setting the Height property sets HeightRule to wdRowHeightAtLeast.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdRowHeightRule HeightRule { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdRowHeightRule get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdRowHeightRule value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the rule for determining the height of the specified rows.

remarks.para: can be one of the following constants:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float HorizontalPosition { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the horizontal distance between the edge of the rows and the item specified by the property.

remarks.para: The HorizonalPosition property can be a number that indicates a measurement in points, or can be one of the following constants: wdTableLeft, wdTableRight, wdTableCenter, wdTableInside, or wdTableOutside.
This property doesn't have any effect if is False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float LeftIndent { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Single that represents the left indent value (in points) for the specified table rows.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property NestingLevel As Integer
public: property int NestingLevel { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the nesting level of the specified rows.

remarks.para: The outermost table has a nesting level of 1. The nesting level of each successively nested table is one higher than the previous table.

remarks.para: can be one of the following constants:

remarks.para: After using this method, use the property to work with the selected items.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetHeight([in]float32 RowHeight, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdRowHeightRule HeightRule) runtime managed
Public Sub SetHeight (RowHeight As Single, HeightRule As WdRowHeightRule)

Docs.param: Required Single. The height of the row or rows, in points.
Required . The rule for determining the height of the specified rows. Can be one of the following WdRowHeightRule constants: wdRowHeightAtLeastwdRowHeightExactlywdRowHeightAuto
Docs.summary: Sets the height of table rows.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetLeftIndent([in]float32 LeftIndent, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdRulerStyle RulerStyle) runtime managed
Public Sub SetLeftIndent (LeftIndent As Single, RulerStyle As WdRulerStyle)

Docs.param: Required Single. The distance (in points) between the current left edge of the specified row or rows and the desired left edge.

Required . Controls the way Microsoft Word adjusts the table when the left indent is changed. Can be one of the following WdRulerStyle constants: wdAdjustNone – Adjusts the left edge of row or rows, preserving the width of all columns by shifting them to the left or right. This is the default value.wdAdjustSameWidth – Adjusts the left edge of the first column, preserving the position of the right edge of the table by setting the widths of all the cells in the specified row or rows to the same value.wdAdjustFirstColumn – Adjusts the left edge of the first column only, preserving the positions of the other columns and the right edge of the table.wdAdjustProportional – Adjusts the left edge of the first column, preserving the position of the right edge of the table by proportionally adjusting the widths of all the cells in the specified row or rows.
Docs.summary: Sets the indentation for a row or rows in a table.

remarks.para: The WdRulerStyle behavior described above applies to left-aligned tables. The WdRulerStyle behavior for center- and right-aligned tables can be unexpected; in these cases, the SetLeftIndent method should be used with care.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Shading As Shading
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ Shading { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Shading ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that refers to the shading formatting for the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float SpaceBetweenColumns { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the distance (in points) between text in adjacent columns of the specified row or rows.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdTableDirection TableDirection { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdTableDirection get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdTableDirection value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the direction in which Microsoft Word orders cells in the specified table or row.

remarks.para: can be one of the following constants:

If the TableDirection property is set to wdTableDirectionLtr, the selected rows are arranged with the first column in the leftmost position. If the TableDirection property is set to wdTableDirectionRtl, the selected rows are arranged with the first column in the rightmost position.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float VerticalPosition { float get(); void set(float value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the vertical distance between the edge of the rows and the item specified by the property.

remarks.para: The return value can be a number that indicates a measurement in points, or can be any valid constant.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int WrapAroundText { int get(); void set(int value); };

Docs.summary: Determines whether text should wrap around the specified rows.

remarks.para: Returns wdUndefined if only some of the specified rows have wrapping enabled.
The property can be set to True or False.
Setting the WrapAroundText property to False also sets the property to False. Setting the AllowOverlap property to True also sets the WrapAroundText property to True.
